content.raw:
I'm seeing a lot of testing seg-faults from inside libruby. I'm starting a jenkins job to see if the problems are reproducible.

~~http://build.osrfoundation.org/view/gazebo/job/gazebo-any-sdformat-any-devel-trusty-amd64/11/~~

~~http://build.osrfoundation.org/view/gazebo/job/gazebo-any-sdformat-any-devel-trusty-amd64/12/~~ this one failed for intel GPU reasons

Just a brief summary: with all 4 physics engines installed, I see a seg-fault in the 4th and final sub-test of `UNIT_ForceTorqueSensor_TEST`. It spits a ton of info with the following at the end:
~~~
[NOTE]
You may have encountered a bug in the Ruby interpreter or extension libraries.
Bug reports are welcome.
For details: http://www.ruby-lang.org/bugreport.html

Aborted (core dumped)
~~~
If I run the final test case on its own, there are no problems. Perhaps there is a follow-up call to ruby that we are missing when it is called multiple times? I have no idea.
content.html:
I'm seeing a lot of testing seg-faults from inside libruby. I'm starting a jenkins job to see if the problems are reproducible.

http://build.osrfoundation.org/view/gazebo/job/gazebo-any-sdformat-any-devel-trusty-amd64/11/

http://build.osrfoundation.org/view/gazebo/job/gazebo-any-sdformat-any-devel-trusty-amd64/12/ this one failed for intel GPU reasons

Just a brief summary: with all 4 physics engines installed, I see a seg-fault in the 4th and final sub-test of UNIT_ForceTorqueSensor_TEST. It spits a ton of info with the following at the end:

[NOTE]
You may have encountered a bug in the Ruby interpreter or extension libraries.
Bug reports are welcome.
For details: http://www.ruby-lang.org/bugreport.html

Aborted (core dumped)

If I run the final test case on its own, there are no problems. Perhaps there is a follow-up call to ruby that we are missing when it is called multiple times? I have no idea.
